H0.text: What is the most abundant substance in the plant kingdom, which no mammal produces the enzyme to digest. Cellulose

H1.text: What is the most abundant substance in the plant kingdom, which no mammal produces the enzyme to digest. Lignin

H2.text: What is the most abundant substance in the plant kingdom, which no mammal produces the enzyme to digest. Pectin

H3.text: What is the most abundant substance in the plant kingdom, which no mammal produces the enzyme to digest. E460

A4.text: Cellulose is the most abundant organic polymer on Earth.

A5.text: Most mammals have limited ability to digest dietary fibre such as cellulose.
